title: 6 maps predicting snowfall totals on Saturday
author: John Waller
bullets: An arctic front will bring snow to Boston from late Friday night through Saturday, according to meteorologists.
Expected snowfall varies, with 2-4 inches for most areas and up to 6 inches possible in eastern Massachusetts.
The National Weather Service highlights potential ocean-enhanced snow, particularly along the coast this Saturday.

title: Think you know the Patriots’ Super Bowl history? Take the quiz.
author: Kelly Chan and Hayden Bird
bullets: Patriots fans can test their knowledge of the team's Super Bowl history with a new quiz.
The quiz revisits memorable moments like the 2017 Super Bowl LI comeback victory.
Patriots face the Seattle Seahawks in the NFL’s biggest stage on Sunday.

title: Patriots star Christian Gonzalez has a big fan in Bruins legend Zdeno Chara
author: Conor Ryan
bullets: Patriots' Christian Gonzalez honors Boston sports icons wearing custom t-shirts, featuring legends like Bill Russell and David Ortiz.
Bruins legend Zdeno Chara praises Gonzalez for wearing a t-shirt with his image, ahead of the Bruins great's jersey retirement.
Gonzalez's postseason stats show excellence, allowing the lowest completion percentage by a defender facing 25+ targets since 2018.

title: Inside the origin of the Patriots’ ‘road warriors’ rallying cry
author: Conor Ryan
bullets: The Patriots, designated home team for Super Bowl LX, chose to wear road whites instead of blue jerseys.
New England Patriots hold a 9-0 record in road games this season, strengthening their 'Road Warriors' identity.
Coach Mike Vrabel introduced 'Road Warriors' concept using clips from wrestling and movies to motivate the team.

title: Did you follow the local news this week? Take our Greater Boston news quiz.
author: Peter Chianca
bullets: Boston.com offers a news quiz to test knowledge on recent Greater Boston stories as of February 6, 2026.
Peter Chianca, a general assignment editor at Boston.com since 2019, oversees the quiz feature.
The quiz covers various local news topics, aiming to keep residents informed and engaged with current events.

title: Legendary Patriots kicker Adam Vinatieri elected to Pro Football Hall of Fame
author: Khari A. Thompson
bullets: Adam Vinatieri was elected to the Pro Football Hall of Fame during the NFL Honors ceremony.
Vinatieri, a four-time Super Bowl champion, is the NFL's all-time scoring leader with 2,673 points.
He is the third kicker in the Hall of Fame, joining Morten Andersen and Jan Stenerud.

title: Drake Maye loses MVP award to Matthew Stafford by razor-thin margin
author: Conor Ryan
bullets: Patriots QB Drake Maye narrowly lost the 2025 NFL MVP race to Rams QB Matthew Stafford by five points.
Matthew Stafford received 24 first-place votes and 366 points; Drake Maye received 23 first-place votes and 361 points.
Maye led NFL in completion percentage and QBR, contributing to the Patriots' 14-3 season and their first AFC East win since 2019.

title: Mike Vrabel named 2025 NFL Coach of the Year
author: Conor Ryan
bullets: Mike Vrabel named 2025 NFL Coach of the Year after leading Patriots to a 17-3 season.
Vrabel previously won Coach of the Year in 2021 with the Tennessee Titans, joining 13 coaches with multiple wins.
Vrabel emphasized accountability and team identity, guiding the Patriots to Super Bowl LX.

title: Unlike Tom Brady, Tedy Bruschi has a dog in the Patriots-Seahawks fight
author: Khari A. Thompson
bullets: Tedy Bruschi openly supports the Patriots in the Super Bowl LX matchup against the Seahawks, unlike Tom Brady who is neutral.
Bruschi cites his friendship with coach Mike Vrabel as a reason for his strong support for the Patriots.
Bruschi draws parallels between the current Patriots team and the 2001 team that won the franchise's first title.

title: Pedestrian struck by police cruiser at UMass Lowell, officials say
author: Molly Farrar
bullets: A pedestrian was struck by a police cruiser at UMass Lowell's South Campus Thursday evening.
The incident occurred near the intersection of Broadway and Wilder Street, outside the McGauvran Center.
Lowell police and Massachusetts State Police are investigating the crash; the pedestrian's condition is unknown.
